definition: flushed with anger (or excitement)
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
variant of 麵|面[mian4]
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc
surname Hong
red/popular/revolutionary/bonus
ear/handle (archaeology)/and that is all (Classical Chinese)
red/scarlet/bare/naked

sentences.english: He has a competive quarrel with his boss.
sentences.chinese: 他和老板争得面红耳赤。

sentences.english: Mr. holohan became very red and excited .
sentences.chinese: 霍罗汉变得面红耳赤，激动极了。

sentences.english: Nikki began to feel abashed by his praise of her beauty.
sentences.chinese: 他赞美着尼基的美貌，使她羞得面红耳赤。

sentences.english: You can talk things over, or even argue, with your boss.
sentences.chinese: 你可以和老板讨论事情，甚至可以争得面红耳赤。

sentences.english: Red in the face, Klaette no longer has prevaricated anything.
sentences.chinese: 面红耳赤的科莱特再也支吾不出什么了。

sentences.english: Rostov flushing hotly drew Dolohov away into the other room.
sentences.chinese: 罗斯托夫面红耳赤，把多洛霍夫喊到另一间房里。

sentences.english: The fire was finally extinguished, but she was still a blushing beauty in tears.
sentences.chinese: 火终于扑灭，但妻子却成了面红耳赤的泪美人。

sentences.english: He argued with the boss until he was blue in the face.
sentences.chinese: 他和老板争得面红耳赤。

sentences.english: This wedding shines on to paint really make me redden up to the ears.
sentences.chinese: 这个结婚照画得真是让我面红耳赤。

sentences.english: Kit shared his views and we had a lot of good arguments.
sentences.chinese: 基特和杰克逊的观点一样，我们常常争得面红耳赤。

definition: red in the face/extremely angry
to blush/to redden (with shame, indignation etc)
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
to turn red (in the face)/to flush (with embarrassment or anger)
to be at a loss for words/speechless
to feel ashamed (idiom)
agape and tongue-tied (idiom); at a loss for words/gaping and speechless
very red/red through and through/to blush (deep red)
lit. dry mouth and tongue (idiom); to talk too much
faulty argument and poor rhetoric (idiom); unable to put forward any convincing arguments/without a leg to stand on
the whole room roaring with laughter (idiom)
to rebuke/to reprimand
fight a battle of words/cross verbal swords
ashamed and unable to show one's face
to stomp or hop about (in anxiety, anger etc)/to dance on one's feet/hopping mad (anxious, etc)
resentful/humiliated and angry
